title: Gerente de Produto (Lancôme) - L'Oréal Luxo
description:
A L'Oréal está presente em mais de 150 países em cinco continentes. Por mais de um século, a L'Oréal dedicou-se exclusivamente a “criar a beleza que move o mundo”; é agora a líder mundial da indústria, com vendas consolidadas de €29 bilhões. Juntos, resolvemos desafios complexos em grande escala, enquanto continuamos comprometidos em tornar o mundo um lugar mais inclusivo e melhor para todos e para o nosso planeta. Experimente a emoção da agilidade para moldar o futuro da beleza; onde diversidade e propósito se unem e criam um impacto significativo.

Na L’Oréal Luxo, criamos a melhor versão da beleza de luxo. Nossa divisão possui um portfólio incomparável de 23 marcas aspiracionais (dentre Yves Saint Laurent, Lancôme, Prada,..) e um time incrivelmente talentoso de 28mil experts, tornando-a perfeitamente equipada para atender às demandas infinitas e abrangentes dos consumidores de luxo em todo o mundo.

Missão

O(A) Gerente de Produto será responsável por impulsionar o crescimento sustentável da marca, categoria ou produto, desenvolvendo e implementando estratégias integradas que ampliem sua relevância no mercado, fortaleçam a identidade e a percepção da marca (brand equity) e gerem resultados consistentes. Isso será alcançado por meio de inovação contínua, profundo entendimento do consumidor e da categoria, e excelência na execução de um marketing mix alinhado às oportunidades e desafios do mercado.

Principais Atividades

  • Definição e Execução da Estratégia de Marca e Produto.
  • Fortalecimento da Identidade e Relevância da Marca.
  • Análise e Compreensão do Consumidor e do Mercado.
  • Gestão do Pipeline de Inovação.
  • Monitoramento do Cenário Competitivo.
  • Liderança em Gestão de Projetos.

Conhecimentos Necessários

  • Estratégia de Marketing e Gestão de Marca.
  • Análise de Mercado e Consumidor.
  • Inovação e Desenvolvimento de Produto.
  • Gestão de Projetos.
  • Mercado e Concorrência.
  • Comunicação e Criação Publicitária.
  • Capacidade Analítica e Financeira.
  • Gestão de Stakeholders.

O Que Você Vai Encontrar

  • Possibilidades de crescimentos, incluindo carreira internacional;
  • Ambiente inclusivo e diverso;
  • Cultura voltada para pessoas, pessoas e pessoas!

Estamos empenhados em garantir processos de recrutamento inclusivos e em defender a contratação e promoção de cada candidato de forma ética e equitativa.

O Grupo proíbe estritamente a discriminação contra qualquer candidato a emprego devido à identidade ou expressão de gênero do indivíduo, orientação sexual, deficiência visível e/ou invisível, origem socioeconômica e/ou multicultural, condições de saúde, idade, religião ou quaisquer outras características protegidas por lei.

Temos orgulho de ser um empregador que oferece oportunidades iguais.

Você precisa ter pelo menos 18 (dezoito) anos para se inscrever. Para mais informações sobre como usamos seus dados pessoais, consulte nossa Política de Privacidade (acesse aqui). O uso do presente site é regido pelos nossos Termos de Uso (acesse aqui). #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Operador(a) Veio Lingotamento IV
description:
Descrição da atividade:

  1. Identificar e solicitar, sempre que necessário, recursos e materiais a fim de suprir as demandas de sua área de atuação, contribuindo para as diversas ações de melhoria.
  2. Zelar e responsabilizar-se pela limpeza, conservação e operacionalização das ferramentas, máquinas, materiais e equipamentos de trabalho de sua área de atuação.
  3. Inspecionar os distribuidores para início de operação e preparar a máquina de Lingotamento Contínuo, bem como seus periféricos.
  4. Retirar e enviar amostras e temperatura do aço líquido no distribuidor e no molde.
  5. Realizar corte de emergência das placas sob orientação.
  6. Realizar a preparação da barra falsa, insumos para partida e troca de distribuidor.
  7. Realizar o aquecimento da válvula submersa e tampão conforme instruções de trabalho vigentes.
  8. Controlar o fluxo de aço da panela para o distribuidor e do distribuidor para o molde.
  9. Operar os painéis externos de controle da máquina de lingotamento.
  10. Realizar a preparação da máquina, preparar barra falsa, molde, etc.
  11. Contribuir para práticas de atividades de metodologia 5S, que envolve: utilização, arrumação, limpeza, padronização e disciplina no ambiente de trabalho.

Pré-requisitos:

  • Ensino Médio Completo.
  • Experiência nas atividades descritas.
  • Disponibilidade para trabalhar em regime de turno.
  • Local de trabalho: Santa Cruz - Rio de Janeiro - RJ

* Lembramos que a Ternium é uma empresa que se preocupa com a inclusão, por isso, todas as nossas vagas também são destinadas à Pessoas com Deficiência e Reabilitados pelo INSS.

title: Gerente de Projetos de TI com foco em Governança
description:
Job description

Ser MJVer é estar em um dos melhores lugares para trabalhar.

Nós sabemos que na construção de uma sociedade mais forte a evolução deve vir de dentro para fora . Por isso, um ambiente acolhedor e com o sentimento constante de pertencimento é fundamental para o crescimento individual e coletivo.

O esforço é de todos nós, e as conquistas também. Porque ser um MJVer é bem mais do que ser um colaborador: é sobre fazer parte.

Somos colaborativos, ágeis, plurais, criativos e inovadores. Somos MJV!

Saiba mais em Quem Somos:



Main responsibilities

Modelo de atuação: Híbrido (São Paulo ou Rio de Janeiro)

Descrição da Vaga:

Estamos em busca de um(a) Gerente de Projetos de TI com forte atuação em Governança para liderar iniciativas estratégicas, garantir a aderência a processos e apoiar a evolução da maturidade de TI na organização. Procuramos uma pessoa com visão sistêmica, capacidade de articulação e foco em resultados.

Responsabilidades /Atribuições:

- Planejar, coordenar e acompanhar projetos de TI com foco em governança, automação e melhoria contínua;

- Garantir a execução das ações previstas em roadmaps estratégicos;

- Atuar em conjunto com analistas de processos e especialistas técnicos na estruturação de fluxos e procedimentos;

- Gerenciar riscos, prazos, escopo e qualidade das entregas;

- Apoiar a definição e o monitoramento de indicadores de desempenho (KPIs);

- Promover a integração entre áreas de negócio e tecnologia.



Requirements and skills

Requisitos:

- Experiência comprovada em gestão de projetos de TI;

- Conhecimento em ITIL e governança de TI;

- Familiaridade com ServiceNow ou outras plataformas de ITSM;

- Vivência com projetos de automação de processos e estruturação de procedimentos operacionais;

- Habilidade para atuar com múltiplas áreas e stakeholders;

- Excelente comunicação, organização e foco em resultados.

Formação:

- Sistemas de Informação, Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas, Gestão de TI ou áreas correlatas;

- Pós-graduação ou certificações são diferenciais, como:

ITIL Foundation ou Intermediate;

COBIT Foundations;

PMP (Project Management Professional);

Scrum Master (CSM ou PSM);

ServiceNow Certified System Administrator.



Additional information

TotalPass;

Vale Refeição;

Seguro de vida em grupo;

Plano de saúde e odontológico - Amil;

️ Grupos de idiomas;

People Mobility: damos uma forcinha para pessoas que tem interesse e disponibilidade de atuar em projetos desafiadores em outros estados e países;

Ações de treinamento: palestras, fóruns, trocas e conversas de conhecimentos relativos ao nosso negócio. Estamos em constante conexão para aprender mais e juntos;

Parcerias: quer desconto? Temos um grupo no Workplace onde divulgamos parcerias com instituições de ensino, escolas de idiomas, academias, restaurantes, produtos e outros serviços;

Programa +MJVer: programa interno de indicação onde você indica um colega para trabalhar conosco e se esse relacionamento der match, você ganha um prêmio;

Co-criação: conectamos talentos para gerar soluções completas. Colaboração está no nosso sangue.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (JavaScript, Architecture, API, SLM AI)
description:
Full Time · Development - Software · Remote

REMOTE FIRST, INCLUSIVE ALWAYS.

EQUALS TRUE started when a type design geek and a talent nerd decided to create real change in the technology industry workforce. So they built the first-in-industry authentic talent partner to help organizations build cultures and scale internationally with the best talent in the Americas.

We are the only organization in Latin America that was founded with a commitment to be inclusive, treat individuals fairly, pay them equally, and provide them with a great professional experience each day, and only want the best. These values are what grounds our business model and practices each day.

We are different, awkward, techie, and weird people in all the right ways. So, if you’re looking for a new career partner who’s remote-first, has a true social mission, and only works with companies that share our values, let’s talk about our Senior Full Stack Engineer role today. Here’s what you need to know about this position:

THE WORK

Work closely with the PM and UX to bring early ideas to life through rapid prototyping and user-centric development.

Lead development across backend and frontend. With a mobile-first, privacy-focused mindset.

Design and implement robust APIs and architecture that can evolve with the product.

Mentor junior developers as the team grows, and help set engineering best practices.

Contribute to projects related to SLM AI& Third-Party AI API’s and apply strong algorithmic thinking to solve complex challenges.

NEEDED EXPERTISE

Solid architectural thinking and the desire to grow into an Architect role within 18-24 months.

Experience working independently in early-stage environments or small teams.

Comfortable collaborating directly with stakeholders and shaping product requirements.

Passion for clean, scalable code, strong attention to detail, and fast iteration cycles.

OUR BENEFITS & PERKS

We pay in USD on a platform that allows you to convert, allocate and disburse your salary as you want and into almost any currency that you choose.

Paid Company Holidays.

Medical, Safety, & Wellness benefits

Free live business language classes

Being part of an organization with a strong social mission for inclusion, fairness, and belonging.

…and more perks being added all the time

Interested? Great! Please send us your CV/Resume to start the conversation and learn more about each other. EQUALS TRUE is a global inclusive talent network of like-minded software engineers, agileist, and design thinkers. We build and develop safe, inclusive, equitable and balanced teams for companies that need to scale globally in a socially responsible way.

EQUALS TRUE is open to all qualified candidates.We never evaluate qualified people on anything other than their skills, work history, training, and ability to do the job. We respect the right of people to live the life they want without judgements. So we practice wage equality, create a culture of belonging, insist upon respect for all our people, make every effort to accommodate all disabilities, and work only with companies that share our values. We are proud to be a global equal opportunity employer. And as such we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, status as a veteran, or any other protected status. We also consider qualified applicants with non-violent and non-financial related criminal histories.

Additionally, EQUALS TRUE is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout our hiring processes. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know.

title: Director, Sales Area
description:
The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.

The Role The Director, Area Sales is responsible for meeting revenue and growth goals within the assigned region in the energy team. This position directly manages a team of Sales Account Managers, reports to the VP, Regional Sales (LATAM) and will be located in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

That experience will have been gained at one of the recognized leaders in enterprise applications or systems technology firms. This individual must have experience leading to the transformation of a sales organization and a strong track record selling enterprise solution at the senior executive level. The ideal candidate will know how to build value for the Company and its customers and have proven experience in doing so over the short, medium and long term.

title: Court Paralegal Team Lead
description:
Our mission is to change as many lives as possible by offering immigration solutions even in the most difficult cases. We look at all possible options to keep our clients in the United States with their families where they belong. We stand ready to fight even when success seems unsure because we understand how much better life can be with the dignity and peace of mind that comes with having documents.

About the role

The Paralegal Team Lead needs to be an exceptional leader and a cooperative team player. The Team Lead must supervise the other paralegals, monitor the work production of the support staff, and identify and engage in ways to improve efficiency.

Payrate: 10$/hr (40 hours per week)

Schedule: Monday to Friday 9:00 am to 6:00 pm EST

What you'll do

1. Supervise and manage a team of Court Team paralegals by providing guidance, support, performance evaluations and management, and payroll to ensure high levels of productivity and morale

2. Create and execute training and development plans for new hires and current team members

3. Attend leadership meetings with up-to-date information on key performance indicators (KPIs), the status of projects, and overall work product of the Court paralegal team

4. Develop and document procedures for new case types as the firm expands its practice areas

5. Oversee and ensure that team members are completing a thorough review of all case information that is returned and identifying opportunities/inconsistencies that require attorneys’ attention

6. Serve as the primary point of escalation for reviewing or processing Court Team requests that are highly complex, unique or unusual

7. Other duties and responsibilities, as assigned by management

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements (Essential Skills, Knowledge & Abilities)

1. Highschool diploma or equivalent

2. Associate's degree in paralegal studies or related field or paralegal certificationpreferred. Relevant experience as an immigration paralegal in a law firm may be substituted for the degree requirement

3. Prior experience with 1 or more of the following immigration fields a plus, VAWA, T-Visa, U-Visa, Asylum, Medical DA, I-601, Adjustment of Status, DS-260, DS-160

4. Strong knowledge of legal terminology, principles, and procedures and experience utilizing these in an immigration setting

5. Advanced computer skills (Proficient with MS Office or similar programs including Adobe, Dropbox, Salesforce, Document Managements, etc.)

6. Possesses excellent English interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, bilingual in Spanish preferred

7. Positive attitude with ability to motivate and manage a diverse team

8. Excellent analytical, problem solving and creative thinking skills

9. Enjoy working in a fast-paced, results driven environment

10. Bilingual (English and Spanish) preferred

title: Process Safety Engineer
description:
Imagine your career taking you to the depths of innovation and the heights of impact. Our people enable continuous progress. Their commitment, collective expertise, and unique capabilities are the engine room behind SBM Offshore’s True. Blue. Transition. - shaping the future of energy, and beyond.

About Us:

SBM Offshore is the world’s deepwater ocean-infrastructure expert. Our work is already resulting in cleaner, more efficient energy production. True. Blue. Transition. is our promise to enable that into the future while supporting new and existing markets in the blue economy. It starts with advancing our core: continuing to decarbonize traditional energy production. We are pioneering more: helping to enable the energy transition and using our ocean infrastructure expertise to support sustainable industry growth. We are sharing our experience for a better blue tomorrow.

Purpose:

  • The Process Safety Engineer develops, implements, and coordinates process safety programs to ensure operational safety and integrity.
  • You analyze process hazards, evaluate safety systems, and ensure regulatory compliance. You play a crucial role in accident prevention, risk minimization, and fostering a strong safety culture.

Responsibilities:

  • You support SBM operations and projects in implementing SBM Offshore’s Hazards and Effects Management Process and Operational Risk Management.
  • You provide guidance on best practices for lifecycle hazard management, including methodologies such as Bowtie, PHA, HAZOP, HAZID, Inherently Safer Design, and barrier-based risk management.
  • You facilitate risk assessments and manage action tracking within the Process Safety scope.
  • You support safety and environmentally critical element audits and assurance activities by technical teams and regulatory bodies.
  • You assist in audits and inspections conducted by regulators, verifiers, or clients.

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree in chemical engineering, process engineering, or a related field.

Experience:

  • Experience in process safety, technical safety, or related risk disciplines (e.g., SLP Engineer).

Functional Competencies:

  • Hazards and Effects Management
  • Hazard Management Monitoring and Performance Compliance
  • Process Analysis and Design
  • Learning from Events
  • Incident Management
  • Safety and Environment Engineering
  • Safety Management
  • Internal Audit
  • Formal Safety Assessment

General Information:

SBM Offshore N.V., headquartered in Amsterdam, is a listed holding company with interests in various subsidiaries forming the SBM Offshore Group. For more information, visit All entities are separate legal entities.

SBM Offshore is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected categories. Employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.

description:

Estamos em busca de professores, instrutores e especialistas para dar aulas particulares online ou presenciais. Não exigimos experiência, apenas paixão por ensinar!

Por que ser um professor na nossa plataforma?

  • Ganhe até R$ 3.000/mês – ou mais, dependendo da sua disponibilidade e dedicação.
  • Horários 100% flexíveis – você escolhe quando e onde quer dar aulas.
  • Sem burocracia – comece a dar aulas rapidamente e receba pelos seus serviços sem complicações.
  • Total liberdade – estabeleça seu próprio preço e personalize suas aulas conforme o perfil dos alunos.
  • Aulas online ou presenciais – trabalhe de qualquer lugar do Brasil, sem sair de casa, ou ofereça aulas presenciais se preferir!
  • Milhares de alunos esperando por você – receba solicitações e conecte-se com estudantes de todo o país.
Tareas
  • Ministrar aulas particulares presenciais ou online.

At BairesDev, we've been leading the way in technology projects for over 15 years. We deliver cutting-edge solutions to giants like Google and the most innovative startups in Silicon Valley.

Our diverse 4,000+ team, composed of the world's Top 1% of tech talent, works remotely on roles that drive significant impact worldwide.

When you apply for this position, you're taking the first step in a process that goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to align your passions and skills with our vacancies, setting you on a path to exceptional career development and success.

Delivery Manager at BairesDev

We are looking for a Delivery Manager to lead and manage a structure of 200+ professionals, including Project Managers, Scrum Masters, and Software Engineers, working for over 30 US-based clients. This is a high-impact role with limitless growth opportunities in the fastest-growing company in the world. Your leadership will ensure that KPIs are met, processes are adhered to, and operations run smoothly.

What You’ll Do:
  1. Lead and mentor teams of Project Managers, ensuring alignment with company goals and KPIs.
  2. Oversee Profit & Loss (P&L) responsibility and management control.
  3. Act as the escalation point for operational and delivery-related issues, ensuring prompt conflict resolution.
  4. Collaborate with the PMO on the execution of procedures for PMs, ensuring consistency and effectiveness.
  5. Work closely with HR Business Partners to enforce HR policies across the team.
  6. Monitor the performance of Project Managers, managing a team ranging between 5 and 10 PMs overseeing 200+ team members.
  7. Ensure efficient reporting and escalation methodologies to maintain smooth operations.
  8. Address HR-related matters with the HRBP and escalate relevant issues as needed.
  9. Present complex operational challenges to Account Managers (AMs) while supporting the relationship between PMs and clients.
  10. Ensure that communication between PMs and Clients is professional, clear, and effective.
What We’re Looking For:
  1. 4+ years of experience as a Delivery Manager, managing teams of 50+ people including 3+ PMs in the IT sector.
  2. Strong IT background and experience managing large-scale software development or tech projects.
  3. Excellent leadership, communication, and conflict-resolution skills.
  4. University degree.
  5. Advanced level of English.
How we do make your work (and your life) easier:
  1. 100% remote work (from anywhere).
  2. Excellent compensation in USD or your local currency if preferred.
  3. Hardware and software setup for you to work from home.
  4. Flexible hours: create your own schedule.
  5. Paid parental leaves, vacations, and national holidays.
  6. Innovative and multicultural work environment: collaborate and learn from the global Top 1% of talent.
  7. Supportive environment with mentorship, promotions, skill development, and diverse growth opportunities.

Join a global team where your unique talents can truly thrive!

  • Personalized support via email and chat to guide you through every step.
Apply for USPS Jobs in California with Confidence

Don't wait to begin your USPS career as a Mail Handler - No Experience Required ! Our program helps you prepare with practice tests, application guidance, and interview tips. Get ready and apply for USPS jobs in California today.

title: Manager, Financial Accounting & Reporting Americas
description:
Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link

Job Function:

Employment Type: Permanent

Yinson is a dynamic, equal opportunity employer with great organisational culture where people are valued and empowered to deliverpowerful solutions.

Job Summary

The Manager, Financial Accounting & Reporting plays a crucial role in overseeing the accounting and financial reporting activities in Brazil. This position is fundamental in ensuring integration of our America offices with the global financial reporting system and processes and acts as a key point of contact with the other global finance teams

Key Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Oversee accounting and financial reporting in compliance with relevant accounting standards, ensuring timely execution of accounting close processes and reporting.
  • Manage month-end closings, including voucher preparation, monthly analyses, and the review and preparation of group reporting packages. Ensure intercompany transactions are processed promptly and accurately.
  • Support the preparation of monthly and quarterly consolidated performance reports for stakeholders and contribute to the annual budgeting process.
  • Implement and maintain financial systems, such as Industrial and Financial Systems (IFS), ensuring proper usage and providing training to team members.
  • Coordinate and fulfil audit and statutory reporting requirements, collaborating with the tax team to ensure tax compliance.
  • Deliver accurate and timely financial reports to stakeholders and investors.
  • Review management papers for ad hoc transactions (e.g., dividends, M&A, Financial result) to support decision-making.
  • Provide accounting expertise and guidance for new projects and transactions.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with external auditors, regulatory authorities, and internal stakeholders regarding financial accounting and reporting.
  • Mentor and supervise junior team members, providing on-the-job training and knowledge transfer.
  • Address ad hoc financial matters and perform additional tasks as assigned by the Head of FA&R Americas

Other Responsibilities:

  • Oversee and ensure proper implementation and compliance with IFRS 16 (Leases), including lease accounting entries, disclosures, and periodic assessment.
  • Liaise with other departments to support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities
  • Strengthen internal controls, drive process improvements, and ensure financial systems are operating effectively operating effectively.
  • Monitor developments in accounting regulations; lead the study, analysis, and execution of new and revised accounting standards and assess their impact on the busines

Requirements and Attributes:

  • Analytical and Reporting Expertise : Demonstrated proficiency in financial analysis and reporting, with comprehensive knowledge of relevant regulatory and accounting standards in global oil and gas companies.
  • Technical Proficiency : Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word, with the ability to manage complex datasets and deliver compelling, professional presentations.
  • Communication and Collaboration : Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, enabling effective collaboration with global finance teams and the production of clear, insightful written reports derived from financial data.
  • Problem-Solving Mindset : Strategic and solution-oriented, with a meticulous and systematic approach to addressing complex financial and operational challenges.
  • Adaptability and Teamwork : Proactive, self-motivated, and able to thrive under tight deadlines in a dynamic, international environment. Strong team player with a collaborative and supportive approach.
  • Time Management : Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple deadlines and priorities.
  • Educational Background : Minimum bachelor’s degree in accounting and postgraduate qualifications. Professional certifications (e.g. CRC) is mandatory.
  • Professional Experience: Experience with a Big 4 firm is advantageous but not mandatory

If you want to team up with us as we dream and stride towards a better tomorrow – we would love to hear from you!

title: IT Service Manager
description:
BAT is evolving at pace into a global multi-category business. Our purpose is to create A Better Tomorrow by Building a Smokeless World.
To achieve our ambition, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to join us on this journey! Tomorrow can’t wait, let’s shape it together!

British American Tobacco Brazil has an exciting opportunity for an IT Service Level Manager in Rio de Janeiro

The Service Level Manager (SLM) is responsible for ensuring that all IT services meet the agreed-upon service levels and performance standards. This role involves managing Service Level Agreements (SLAs), supervising service performance, and working closely with both internal teams and external vendors to ensure high-quality service delivery. The SLM will play a crucial role in aligning IT services with business objectives and customer expectations.

The position requires strong alignment with ITIL best practices, COBIT governance principles, and industry performance benchmarks. The SLM is also a key agent in driving continuous improvement, digital transformation, and the innovation of user-centric services.

Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Develop, negotiate, and handle SLAs with internal and external partners and supervise and report on service performance against SLAs.
  • Conduct regular reviews of SLAs to ensure they remain relevant and aligned with business needs.
  • Maintain a centralized and accessible Service Catalogue and being responsible for ITSM governance, for example, incident, change, problem and transition management.
  • Use data-driven insights to predict and prevent potential service disruptions and analyze service performance and structured root cause analysis data to identify trends and areas for improvement.
  • Manage capacity and delivery plan (internal and external teams)
  • Act as the primary point of contact for all service-related issues and escalations and communicate service performance and improvement plans to partners.
  • Lead initiatives to improve service delivery processes and enhance customer satisfaction and promote user-centric innovation and stay updated with industry standard methodologies and emerging trends in IT service management.
  • This position needs to manage all the running cost of IT, always looking for saving opportunities, cost avoidance and other ways to bring efficiency. Also responsible for IT Services project budget.

What are we looking for?

  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT service management or a related role.
  • Proven track record of managing SLAs and improving service delivery in a large organization and demonstrated success in managing SLAs, dashboards, vendor relationships, and governance reporting.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and manage multiple partners.
  • Advanced English verbal and written; Spanish it´s a nice to have.
  • Experience Level Management (XLA) skills to improve user experience levels and ensure smooth operations and strategic mentality with focus on innovation, agility, and experience management.

What we offer you?
• We offer a market leading annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility)
• Our range of benefits varies by country and includes diverse health plans, initiatives for work-life balance, transportation support, and a flexible holiday plan with additional incentives
• Your journey with us isn't limited by boundaries; it's propelled by your aspirations. Join us at BAT and become a part of an environment that thrives on internal advancement, where your career progression isn't just a statement – it's a reality we're eager to build together. Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.
• You'll have access to online learning platforms and personalized growth programs to nurture your leadership skills
• We prioritise continuous improvement within a transformative environment, preparing for ongoing changes

WHY JOIN BAT?
We’re one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute – certified in offering excellent employee conditions.

Collaboration, inclusion and partnership underpin everything we do here at BAT. We are looking forward to enabling every individual to thrive, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio-economic and professional background, veteran status, perspectives and thinking styles. We know that embracing talent from all backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals.

We see the career breaks as opportunities not obstacles. Through The Global Returners program, we support professionals looking to restart their careers after an extended absence from the workforce (e.g. time out caring for family, parental leave, national service, sabbatical and/or starting an own venture).

Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience here.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best during the recruitment process, you are encouraged to notify us. We are fully committed to support you by making appropriate arrangements for you to demonstrate your full potential.

title: Print & Multimedia Designer (100% remote - Brazil)
description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our solutions enable businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing blockchain technology, Tether allows you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, at a low cost. Transparency is fundamental to our approach, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our product suite features the trusted stablecoin, USDT , used by hundreds of millions worldwide, along with digital asset tokenization services.

And that’s just the start:

Tether Power: Our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Advancing AI and peer-to-peer tech, we reduce infrastructure costs and improve global communications with solutions like KEET , our secure data sharing app.

Tether Education : We democratize access to digital learning, empowering individuals in the digital and gig economies for global growth.

Tether Evolution : We push technological and human potential boundaries, shaping a future where innovation and human capabilities merge.

Why Join Us?

Our team is globally distributed, working remotely. If you’re passionate about fintech innovation, this is your chance to collaborate with top minds, push boundaries, and set industry standards. We’ve grown quickly, stayed agile, and established industry leadership.

If you have excellent English communication skills and want to contribute to the most innovative platform, Tether is for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About the job

As a Print & Multimedia Designer, you will craft visually compelling print assets for events, campaigns, and multimedia content. Collaborating with marketing, business development, and external partners, you will ensure brand-aligned, accurate design content that supports successful events and campaigns.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create high-quality print materials and event graphics supporting Tether’s initiatives, ensuring visual consistency and collaborating with production partners for flawless execution.
  • Develop visual content for landing pages, social media banners, campaign imagery, and videos across platforms.
  • Design innovative concepts for Tether’s units, focusing on fintech and communication tech.
  • Customize content for each channel to boost engagement and traffic.
  • Share design ideas and insights, contributing to marketing success.

Job Requirements:

  • Minimum 3 years proven experience as a Graphic Designer with a focus on print and multimedia for events.
  • Expertise in creating print materials, with attention to detail and quality.
  • Proficiency in AI graphic tools like Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, and Pika Labs.
  • A modern portfolio showcasing event and multimedia projects.
  • Strong knowledge of social media platforms (LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, Reddit, Facebook, Keet) and content strategies.
  • Fluent English communication skills; Spanish or Italian is a plus.
  • Advanced skills in Figma and Adobe Suite (After Effects is a plus).
  • Understanding of branding and adherence to guidelines.
  • Self-motivated, proactive, and passionate about innovation.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
  • Team player with professionalism and a strong work ethic.

Perks:

  • Work with passionate, talented colleagues.
  • Learn about blockchain and crypto.
  • Remote work with flexible hours.
  • Engage in creatively challenging projects daily.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
About Us:
At edclub, we are committed to revolutionizing the way K-12 students learn through engaging and interactive educational content. We create comprehensive, high-quality courses that inspire curiosity and facilitate deep learning. We're seeking a talented Designer to join our dynamic team to help bring educational content to life with creativity and purpose.

Job Description:
We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented UI/UX Designer to join our team. In this role, you will design educational materials that enhance learning experiences for students. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of user experience principles and a passion for creating intuitive, visually appealing digital products. You will collaborate with project managers, developers, and content creators to produce visually engaging and interactive educational tools.

This role will be fully remote, as our headquarters are located in Rockville, Maryland, USA.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Create graphics, illustrations, and visual elements for experiences that align with educational objectives.
  2. Work closely with curriculum and content teams to ensure design elements support educational goals.
  3. Ensure a consistent visual style that is age-appropriate and accessible to diverse audiences.
  4. Collaborate with the team to brainstorm creative ideas and solutions for presenting content in innovative ways.
  5. Create engaging animations and motion graphics to enhance student learning and understanding.
  6. Stay up-to-date with design trends, animation techniques, and educational tools to continuously improve content quality.

Qualifications:

  1. 3-5 years of proven experience in graphic and UI/UX design.
  2. Proficiency in Figma and Adobe Illustrator; experience with animation tools like After Effects, Blender, or similar.
  3. Strong portfolio showcasing a range of design and animation work.
  4. Understanding of visual storytelling, typography, and layout principles.
  5. Knowledge of user-centered design principles and how students of different age groups engage with content.
  6. Communicate effectively in English with team members.
  7. Collaborative attitude with a willingness to accept feedback and adapt designs accordingly.
  8. Ability to think creatively and bring innovative ideas to enhance student engagement.

title: Senior QA Analyst
description:
The Company You’ll Join

Carta connects founders, investors, and limited partners through world-class software, purpose-built for everyone in venture capital, private equity and private credit.

Carta’s fund administration platform supports nearly 7,000 funds and SPVs, representing $150B in assets under administration in venture capital and private equity. Trusted by more than 40,000 companies, Carta also helps private businesses in over 160 countries manage their cap tables, valuations, taxes, equity programs, compensation, and more.

Together, Carta is creating the end-to-end ERP platform for private markets. Traditional ERP solutions don’t work for Private Funds. Private capital markets need a comprehensive software solution to replace outdated spreadsheets and fragmented service providers. Carta’s software for the Office of the Fund CFO does just that - it’s a new category of software to make private markets look more like public markets - a connected ERP for private capital.

For more information about our offices and culture, check out our Carta careers page.

The Problems You’ll Solve

At Carta, our employees set out on a mission to unlock the power of equity ownership for more people in more places. We believe that the problems we solve today unlock the opportunities of tomorrow.

As a Senior Software QA Analyst , you will partner with the R&D teams to ensure product quality, assist with direction, and act as a liaison between Business and Engineering. As part of the role, your day-to-day activities will include the creation, execution and management of manual and automated tests within the testing cycles.

  • Attend development meetings, such as daily stand ups and sprint plannings.
  • Help to handle engineering workload and coordinate with engineering + product on daily basis
  • Review and criticise product specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
  • Cooperate with developers, product managers and business to gather system requirements and write testing scenarios/acceptance criteria based on them.
  • Ensure all technical teams have the information they need to develop solutions to the problem as efficiently as possible.
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans to both assess new product launches and periodically test existing products.
  • Write, execute and maintain manual test cases
  • Write, execute and maintain automated test cases
  • Periodically aggregate your findings and present on what issues most impact product quality (not limited to bugs)
  • Plan and coordinate testing activities, such as individual or group testing sessions.
  • Thoroughly identify and document bugs from testing.
  • Triage production bugs from your product domain (validate the bug, provide Business context to Engineers and follow up with bug reporters).
  • Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved or any changes are introduced to the system.
  • Be an expert in how to service QA across different development methodologies, using the appropriate testing technique, process and/or tool.
  • Assist the QA team with testing requests out of your product domain expertise.
  • Participate in side projects to develop internal and company wide Quality processes and procedures.
  • Mentor junior team members
  • Independently identify problems and proactively drive solutions.
  • Capable of owning and driving strategic initiatives on behalf of the QA organization
  • You consistently achieve metrics displayed on team's playbook
The Team You’ll Work With

The QA Organization consists of ~15 QAs who work closely with our Product, Engineering, and Support teams. We work cross-functionally across the organization to make sure we are testing our product before our clients get to use them. This is a highly visible and critical role to help define and implement QA processes within different teams, plus help with manual and automation testing to test our products thoroughly and deliver with high quality.

About You

Hard Skills

  • 4+ years of experience as a Quality Assurance Analyst/Tester/Automation Engineer.
  • Experience writing automation in either Python, Java, Javascript, or other languages.
  • Experience with Python, pytest and Selenium is a plus.
  • Fluency in English with strong written and verbal communication skills (we communicate closely with global teams on a daily basis!)

Soft Skills

  • Highly autonomous - able to operate with little to no day-to-day oversight in ambiguity
  • Organized, detailed, and methodical approach to solving problems
  • Care deeply about building flawless user experiences.
  • Relentless and unconventional - think outside of the box and create unique scenarios for testing
  • Helpful - successful cross-functional collaborator, has gone beyond core activities to support other teams, processes and initiatives.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Disclosures:

  • We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a positive interview experience for every candidate. If accommodations due to a disability or medical condition are needed, please connect with the talent partner via email.

title: Senior Control Engineer
description:
Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:

We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Job Duties

Position Summary

  • Demonstrates creativity, foresight, and mature engineering judgment in solving complex problems during the development and application of new and improved products and processes.
  • Establishes best practices incorporating Reliability, Health, Safety, and Environment principles to guide others in analysis and design.
  • Evaluates proposed theoretical results to meet design requirements.
  • Acts as a technical expert, solving system equations and creating custom models to simplify problems using advanced engineering tools.
  • Coaches, develops, and reviews the work of other engineers.
  • Possesses excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams.
  • Contributes to Halliburton’s Intellectual Property portfolio with innovative and commercially viable solutions.
  • Works across global teams (Brazil, US, Singapore, India).
  • Closely collaborates with Electrical Engineering, Systems Engineering, and Project Management teams at the Halliburton Technology Center in Brazil (HBTC).
Qualifications
  • Master’s or doctoral degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) or a closely related discipline is preferred.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  • 10+ years in R&D, preferably in multidisciplinary and international team environments.
  • Proven experience designing complex system solutions across Oil & Gas, mining, and/or aerospace industries.
  • Background in subsea applications and well control solutions involving multiple disciplines is desirable.
  • Experience in well intervention solutions is also desirable.
  • Ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • Regularly prepares and delivers technical status reports to stakeholders.
  • Proficient in Risk Assessment, FMEA, and other reliability methodologies.
  • Knowledge of power control and communication systems/solutions.
  • Advanced skills in electronic circuit design and simulators (e.g., LTSPICE, PSPICE), as well as math tools like Matlab and MathCAD, focused on embedded systems in harsh environments (O&G, mining, aerospace).
  • Experience with system automation using robotics.
  • Skilled in modeling, control design, and simulation of electromechanical systems using standard tools (Matlab, LabView, ROS, PLC software, etc.).
  • Strong knowledge in control system design, signal processing, feedback loops, and system dynamics.
  • Familiarity with ROV operations, subsea inspection, and autonomous underwater systems is a plus.
  • Understanding of MIMO in motion planning (sensing and feedback for power/torque control).

Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, citizenship, marital status, sex/gender, sexual preference/ orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, national origin, or any other status protected by law or regulation .

Location

Requisition Number: 200284
Experience Level: Experienced Hire
Job Family: Engineering/Science/Technology
Product Service Line: Wireline and Perforating
Full Time / Part Time: Full Time

Additional Locations for this position:

Compensation Information
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience.

title: Gestor Contábil
description:
• Gerir os setores contábil, administrativo e financeiro do Family Office.
  • Requer inglês avançado porque tem contato com o exterior.

Sobre nosso cliente

Nosso cliente é um Family Office com capital robusto sob gestão.

Descrição

  • Garantir que todos os processos contábeis e de backoffice estejam de acordo com os controles internos e as políticas da empresa.
  • Identificar, monitorar e mitigar riscos operacionais associados às atividades de negociação.
  • Gerenciar e manter o ciclo contábil completo para as duas empresas, garantindo precisão e conformidade com todas as regulamentações e padrões relevantes.
  • Preparar e submeter a Diretoria semanalmente todos os pagamentos e recebimento de aluguéis
  • Administrar as demonstrações contábeis/financeiras terceirizadas adequando aos padrões internos.
  • Revisar a preparação e submissão de declarações fiscais e outros relatórios regulatórios.
  • Apoiar as operações de negociação, reconciliando os dados de negociação para ações, produtos de renda fixa e mercados futuros diariamente.
  • Monitorar e gerenciar fluxos de caixa, garantindo que todas as negociações sejam registradas e liquidadas com precisão.
  • Manter e atualizar sistemas internos para refletir todas as atividades de negociação, incluindo negociações internacionais e estratégias sistemáticas.
  • Produzir, através dos sistemas automatizados já existentes os P&L's diários, mensais e anuais da carteira de investimentos.
  • Auxiliar no desenvolvimento e implementação de procedimentos operacionais para aumentar a eficiência e reduzir riscos, inclusive sugerindo e promovendo melhorias nos sistemas atuais
  • Interagir com contrapartes em relação à reconciliação e liquidação de negociações.


Perfil desejável

  • Bacharelado em Contabilidade, Finanças ou área relacionada. CRC ou certificação equivalente é preferível.
  • Mínimo de 5 anos de experiência em contabilidade no setor bancário, gestão de ativos ou serviços financeiros.
  • Bom entendimento de produtos financeiros.
  • Familiaridade com operações de backoffice.
  • Excelentes habilidades analíticas, organizacionais e de resolução de problemas.
  • Atenção aos detalhes e capacidade de trabalhar independentemente e como parte de uma equipe.
  • Fortes habilidades de comunicação, tanto escrita quanto verbal.
  • Inglês avançado.

O que está sendo ofertado

  • Salário competitivo;
  • Benefícios como Vale Refeição e Plano de Saúde;
  • Ambiente de trabalho positivo e motivador;
  • Oportunidades para desenvolvimento profissional.

title: Esteticista Terapeuta Jardim Botânico MSS - RJ
description:
Esteticista Terapeuta Jardim Botânico #MSS

O objetivo deste profissional é proporcionar atendimentos técnicos de alta qualidade aos clientes através da aplicação de terapias e tratamentos corporais, alinhando-se com a filosofia, protocolos exclusivos e os padrões de excelência do Buddha Spa.

Atividades:

  1. Realizar terapias e tratamentos corporais tais como massagens relaxantes, shiatsu, drenagem, modeladora, massagem desportiva, ayurvédica, entre outras, conforme os protocolos do Buddha Spa.
  2. Manter-se atualizado e seguir rigorosamente as técnicas e procedimentos ensinados durante os treinamentos.
  3. Assegurar a satisfação dos clientes através da prestação de serviços de alta qualidade.
  4. Seguir as orientações gerais e específicas do spa para garantir um desempenho superior.
  5. Realizar os rituais de atendimento com todos os clientes, a fim de proporcionar a completa experiência e aumentar seu potencial de fidelização.
  6. Engajar-se no plano de incentivo oferecido pela sua unidade, aderindo à filosofia de atuação e incentivo profissional promovida pelo Buddha Spa.

Habilidades e competências:

  1. Domínio das técnicas de massoterapia e tratamentos corporais oferecidos pelo Buddha Spa, que é confirmado após mentoria do Sr. Jayme Santos, aprovação do Profissional Técnico responsável pelo treinamento e liberação da equipe técnica do Buddha Spa College.
  2. Capacidade de seguir protocolos e procedimentos com precisão.
  3. Habilidade para proporcionar uma experiência excepcional aos clientes.
  4. Capacidade de comunicar-se claramente com os clientes e colegas.
  5. Capacidade de tomar iniciativa e resolver problemas de maneira proativa.
  6. Capacidade de gerenciar o tempo eficientemente e cumprir horários rigorosamente, tendo o compromisso com sua agenda de clientes em turno definido conforme sua disponibilidade e regras contratuais.

Requisitos:

Possuir formação nas áreas de Massoterapia, Fisioterapia, Estética, Naturologia, Naturopatia, Terapias Integrativas, Biomedicina, Enfermagem, Educação Física e Farmácia com pós em Estética. As formações podem ser cursos técnicos ou graduações. É aceitável estar cursando, desde que pelo menos 50% do curso esteja concluído ou que as aulas de anatomia estejam finalizadas.

Benefícios:

Contratação: PJ
Remuneração: R$2.000,00 + comissão por atendimento realizado + Plano de incentivo.

  • Identificar e quantificar oportunidades de crescimento e tendências de mercado, fornecendo insights para a Assistente Comercial responsável pelo CRM.
  • Desenvolver painéis e dashboards no Power BI conforme demandas da Diretoria e necessidades da área comercial.
  • Gerenciar tratativas comerciais com Parceiros (Aliança), incluindo cobrança de taxas adicionais, alinhamento de processos e cadastro de taxas.
  • Manter contato constante com Parceiras (Aliança) e setores internos da Generoso (qualidade, contas a receber, financeiro, etc.) para resolução de demandas comerciais.

Estamos em busca de um Auxiliar de Instalação de Esquadrias de PVC para integrar nossa equipe dinâmica e colaborativa.   • Desejo de aprender e desenvolver novas habilidades na área de instalação de esquadrias.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e seguir instruções.
  • Boa disposição física para atividades que exigem esforço.

Se você busca uma oportunidade para iniciar sua carreira e desenvolver-se em uma empresa líder no setor de aberturas, a Weiku do Brasil é o lugar certo para você! Envie seu currículo e venha fazer parte do nosso time de sucesso.

Sobre a empresa

A Weiku do Brasil é uma empresa reconhecida pela produção, comercialização e instalação de janelas, portas e vidros personalizados de altíssimo padrão. Com sede em Pomerode, Santa Catarina, e unidades em Campinas, SP, e Uberlândia, MG, nossa missão é oferecer soluções inovadoras e sustentáveis, sempre priorizando a satisfação dos nossos clientes.

title: Associate Director, Marketing (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Summary

In the online travel industry, with fast changing user behavior and the increasing role played by price comparison websites, offering the best price grants disproportionate gains. Travelers chose Agoda because they are confident that with us they can find the best hotels, at the best price.

In this environment, we can only achieve success by being able to optimize our prices to balance short-term margins with long-term growth employing a strategic approach to take into account the reactions from the other players in the game, from customers to hotels, from competitors to regulatory bodies.

To this end, we are looking for a senior leader to craft Agoda’s global Pricing strategy and execute upon it, using a wide range of tactics and tools, from price display to machine learning algorithms.

He or she will closely coordinate with Agoda’s senior management, marketing and product teams, while managing and expanding a team of talented pricing managers and analysts.

What you would be doing

  • Work with C-level executives and other internal stakeholders to craft a global pricing strategy, taking into account Agoda’s strategic priorities
  • Manage a multi-million dollar budget and provide visibility to internal stakeholders
  • Work with the Product team to build the tools to execute and monitor pricing actions and to improve price display across all channels
  • Work with the Market Development team to collect benchmarking data and intelligence from local markets, and to respond to moves from competitors and hotel partners
  • Design and deploy pricing campaigns, balancing short term financial goals with the longer term strategic imperatives
  • Inspire and coach a team of analysts and campaign managers and expand it by hiring talent

What you need to be good at to succeed in this role

  • Experience in articulating strategic issues and negotiating with C-level executives – experience in leading strategy consulting projects a plus
  • Excellent analytical skills – you really need to love data for this role
  • Ability to foster cooperation across teams and across nationalities
  • People management – track record of hiring and developing stars
  • P&L management
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, get-things-done attitude
  • Exposure to IT and Product Development

title: Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Engineer
description:
Job Title: Cisco Routing & Switching Engineers (Remote – 3 Openings)
Contract Duration: 12 Months (Full-Time, 40 Hours/Week)
Start Date: May 12th, 2025
Location: 100% Remote – Work from Home
Hourly Rate: $40.00 USD
Skill Level: Strong CCNA or CCNP-Level Network Engineer
Shift: Working hours are 8am to 5pm CST

Overview:

Arganteal is actively seeking three full-time Cisco Routing & Switching Engineers for a 12-month remote engagement. These roles support a nationwide SD-WAN and Catalyst switch migration effort beginning next week. If you're an experienced engineer available to start immediately and ready for remote work, we encourage you to apply today.

Open Positions:

  • 1 Staging Engineer

  • 2 Migration/Deployment Engineers

Responsibilities:

  • Configure Cisco C8300 SD-WAN Routers on vManage using established MOP templates provided by the lead WWT architect.

  • Leverage CSV files and scripts to manage router configuration variables and deploy at scale.

  • Troubleshoot configuration issues related to Cisco C8300 SD-WAN routers .

  • Create and validate Catalyst switch configurations using standardized templates, with a focus on VLANs, interfaces, and routing.

  • Develop Bills of Materials (BOMs) based on current environments and standard replacement hardware.

  • Draft detailed Method of Procedures (MOPs) for each site or device migration.

  • Provide real-time support during migrations, assisting remote and onsite technicians with network issues such as incorrect VLAN assignments, missing configs, or interface problems.

  • Update and apply missing configurations on Cisco switches including:

    • VLANs

    • Voice VLANs

    • Routed interfaces

  • Communicate effectively with project stakeholders, including network engineers and field technicians.

Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of Cisco networking , ideally at a CCNA (minimum) or CCNP level.

  • Hands-on experience with Cisco SD-WAN , particularly vManage and C8300 series routers.

  • Proficiency with Cisco Catalyst switches , including Layer 2 and Layer 3 configurations.

  • Experience deploying or implementing from MOP files and working in structured migration / deployment scenarios.

  • Strong troubleshooting and communication skills

title: OT Cybersecurity Technical Architect M/F
description:
OT Cybersecurity Technical Architect M/FGeneral information

OT Cybersecurity Technical Architect M/F

As an Independent Power Producer,Voltalia operates in over 20 countries, developing, building, and maintainingrenewable energy projects and services across five key technologies: solar,wind, hydro, biomass, and storage. Backed by the AFM Group, a globallyrecognized, family-owned investment group, we benefit from long-term stabilityand a shared commitment to sustainable growth.

By the end of 2024, our operational and under-construction capacity reached 3.3 gigawatts—a 14% increase since 2023. With 1,500 employees worldwide, we thrive in a fast-moving environment driven by adaptability, innovation, and collaboration.

In our company, your work directly contributes to a more sustainable world. Whether you're driving projects forward, optimizing operations, or leading strategic initiatives, you're contributing to our mission to improve the global environment and foster local development.

At Voltalia, we welcome individuals from all backgrounds, whatever your race, ethnicity, gender, nationality, age, disability, sexual orientation, and experience. In our company, diversity drives innovation and contributes to a workplace where everyone can thrive.

Ready to make an impact? Bring your energy—let’s power a sustainable future together!

YOUR MISSIONS

The OT Cybersecurity Technical Architect is responsible for designing and implementing the technical components of the organization's cybersecurity strategy. This role involves creating secure systems and network architectures, selecting and configuring security technologies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure the organization's digital assets are adequately protected.

  • Develop and implement OT cybersecurity architectures tailored for renewable energy production and operations.
  • Design secure and scalable network architectures for OT environments, including SCADA, ICS, and IoT systems.
  • Ensure OT security strategies align seamlessly with corporate IT and cybersecurity policies, while also adhering to industry standards, including IEC 62443 and ISO 27001.
  • Implement and supervise cybersecurity tools, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and vulnerability scanners, in OT environments.
  • Monitor and respond to OT security incidents, collaborating with incident response teams.
  • Collaborate with GRC team to address regulatory requirements.
  • Work closely with engineering, operations, and IT teams to integrate security into the lifecycle of OT assets.
  • Provide cybersecurity training and awareness programs for staff working with OT systems.
  • Engage with external vendors and partners to ensure secure deployment of third-party OT solutions.
  • Stay updated on emerging cybersecurity threats, trends, and technologies relevant to OT environments.
  • Develop and implement strategies for continuous improvement of OT cybersecurity posture.
  • Lead pilot projects and proof-of-concept initiatives for new cybersecurity technologies.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCES

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in cybersecurity, with at least 2 years focusing on OT environments (e.g., SCADA, ICS).
  • Deep knowledge of OT systems and protocols, including Modbus, DNP3, OPC, and MQTT.
  • Proficiency with cybersecurity frameworks like IEC 62443, NIST CSF, and MITRE ATT&CK for ICS.
  • Familiarity with firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and endpoint protection in OT environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking principles (e.g., VLANs, VPNs, routing).
  • Experience in renewable energy or other critical infrastructure industries is a plus.
  • CISSP, GICSP, CISM, or equivalent certifications preferred.
  • Proficiency both in Portuguese and English.
  • Availiability for international travels.

KEY SKILLS

  • Strategic Vision-
  • Problem-Solving and organizational skills.
  • Strong ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and collaborate across multidisciplinary teams.
  • Proficiency in building relationships with internal and external partners to drive cybersecurity initiatives.
  • Resilient
  • Strong attention to detail to ensure precision in designing, implementing, and auditing cybersecurity measures.
  • Flexibility to respond to evolving cybersecurity threats and technological advancements.

description:
Head of Communications Latam

Location: Brazil as a first preference (due to Portuguese speaking requirement)

Do you want to be part of ahigh performingteam and enjoy newchallenges?

”Aon is in the business of better decisions

At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.

Purpose of the Role

The Head of Communications Latam will be responsible for leading the internal and external communication strategy in the region, aligning messages with Aon's global vision and strengthening the brand's reputation. This role is key to connecting our teams, clients, and stakeholders through a coherent, inclusive, and impact-oriented narrative.

Main Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement the regional communications strategy (internal and external).
  • Act as a strategic advisor for regional leaders on communication matters.
  • Oversee multi-channel communication campaigns, including digital media, PR, and events.
  • Ensure brand and tone consistency across all touchpoint
  • Manage crisis and sensitive communications with an ethical and timely approach.
  • Measure the impact of communication initiatives and propose continuous improvements.
  • Lead the internal & external regional communications team.

Desired Profile

  • +8 years of experience in corporate communications, ideally in multinational companies.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in a leadership role in communications
  • Bachelor degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, or related fields.
  • Exceptional writing, storytelling, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Experience leading teams and projects in multicultural environments.
  • Proficiency in English, Spanish and Portuguese.
  • Strategic mindset, results-oriented, and highly adaptable.
  • Commitment to diversity, inclusion, and collaboration.
  • Deep knowledge of social media platforms and digital communication tools.
  • Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple projects simultaneously.

How we support our colleagues

In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.

title: Eletricista
description:
O Profissional de Manutenção é responsável por executar a manutenção preventiva, corretiva e preditiva de sistemas elétricos, mecânicos e estruturais, garantindo o pleno funcionamento das instalações e a segurança dos ambientes. Este profissional desempenha um papel crucial na manutenção e operação eficiente dos equipamentos e sistemas da empresa.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Realizar manutenção preventiva e corretiva em sistemas elétricos, mecânicos e estruturais, garantindo o funcionamento adequado e seguro dos equipamentos e instalações.
  • Diagnosticar e reparar falhas e defeitos em sistemas elétricos, como painéis, fiações, tomadas e interruptores, além de sistemas mecânicos e hidráulicos conforme necessário.
  • Executar a instalação e substituição de componentes elétricos e mecânicos, como motores, circuitos e dispositivos de controle.
  • Realizar inspeções regulares nos sistemas e equipamentos para identificar e corrigir possíveis problemas antes que se tornem críticos.
  • Ler e interpretar esquemas elétricos, diagramas e manuais técnicos para realizar as manutenções e reparos de acordo com as especificações.
  • Manter registros detalhados de todas as atividades de manutenção realizadas, incluindo as peças substituídas e os problemas encontrados.
  • Trabalhar em conformidade com as normas de segurança e regulamentos aplicáveis, utilizando equipamentos de proteção individual (EPIs) e técnicas seguras.
  • Colaborar com outros membros da equipe e supervisores para garantir a eficiência e a qualidade na execução das atividades.
  • Participar de treinamentos e atualizações técnicas para se manter informado sobre novas tecnologias e práticas de manutenção.
  • Responder a chamadas de emergência e realizar reparos urgentes para minimizar o tempo de inatividade e garantir a continuidade das operações.

Requisitos:

  • Ensino médio completo ou técnico na área de elétrica, mecânica ou áreas relacionadas.
  • Experiência prévia em manutenção elétrica, mecânica e estrutural, com conhecimento em diagnóstico e reparo de falhas.
  • Conhecimento técnico em sistemas elétricos, mecânicos e hidráulicos, incluindo leitura de esquemas e diagramas.
  • Certificações e treinamentos específicos na área de manutenção (desejável).
  • Experiência com ferramentas e equipamentos de manutenção.

  • Fazer gestão de projetos/jobs: controlando e documentado step by step, com briefing e cronogramas, garantindo que prazos e acordos sejam cumpridos;
  • Através de data driven e relacionamento, identificar/antecipar oportunidades, rupturas e necessidades.

O que mais oferecemos:

  • Gestão meritocrática, através de Objetivos Chave de Resultados (OKRs);
  • Possibilidade de sociedade baseada no desempenho e alinhamento cultural com o negócio.

title: Third Engineer (Ilhas Marshall)
description:
Localização: Rio de Janeiro – Embarque Offshore (bandeira Ilhas Marshall)

Departamento: Engenharia

Escala: Conforme programação da embarcação


Resumo da Posição:

Buscamos um(a) 3rd Engineer Officer (também conhecido como 2nd Assistant Engineer – OICEW, STCW III/1) para atuação em unidade offshore com bandeira das Ilhas Marshall. O profissional será responsável por auxiliar na operação, monitoramento e manutenção dos sistemas de propulsão e equipamentos da praça de máquinas, atuando em conformidade com as exigências internacionais (STCW) e com os certificados exigidos pelas Ilhas Marshall .


Qualificações Necessárias:

  • Certificação STCW III/1 – 3rd Engineer / 2nd Assistant Engineer (OICEW), sem limitação de potência ou área geográfica
  • Mínimo de 4 anos de experiência na indústria naval
  • 1 a 2 anos de experiência comprovada como 4º Oficial de Máquinas / 3rd Assistant Engineer (OICEW)
  • Formação completa em Academia ou Universidade Marítima reconhecida
  • Conclusão de todos os treinamentos e certificações obrigatórias , conforme matriz de treinamento


Certificados Obrigatórios – Ilhas Marshall:

  • Officer in Charge of Engineering Watch – Marshall Islands (CRP1367)
  • STCW Basic Safety Training (BST) (CRP339)
  • Proficiency in Survival Craft – Marshall Islands (PSCMI)
  • STCW PSCRB – Proficiency in Survival Craft & Rescue Boat (CRP251)
  • STCW Fast Rescue Boat / Craft (CRP951)
  • Advanced Fire Fighting (CRP1015)
  • Medical First Aid (CRP530)
  • HUET – Helicopter Underwater Escape (OPITO Approved) (CRP817)
  • ISPS Security Familiarization (A-VI/6)
  • DP Awareness (CRP960)
  • Engine Resource Management (ERM)


Certificações Complementares – Normas Brasileiras (NR):

  • NR-12 – Operação de Máquinas e Equipamentos (8h) (CRP1061)
  • NR-33 – Espaço Confinado (16h) (CRP859)
  • NR-35 – Trabalho em Altura (8h) (CRP565)
  • NR-37 – Treinamento de Primeira Embarcação (6h) (CRP1350)
  • NR-37 – Controle de Qualidade da Água em Unidades Offshore (16h) (CRP1602)


Exame Médico:

  • Certificado de Exame Médico Marítimo válido (CRP582), conforme STCW e diretrizes da empresa


Responsabilidades Principais:

  • Apoiar na operação e manutenção de todos os sistemas da praça de máquinas
  • Cumprir os turnos de plantão de máquinas conforme designado (OICEW)
  • Garantir a conformidade com padrões de segurança, meio ambiente e regulamentos internacionais
  • Auxiliar no diagnóstico de falhas técnicas e na resolução de problemas operacionais
  • Preencher os registros e relatórios técnicos conforme procedimentos internos


Desejável:

  • Boa comunicação em inglês técnico
  • Perfil proativo, organizado e com foco em segurança operacional
  • Experiência anterior em embarcações com bandeira estrangeira (preferencialmente Ilhas Marshall)

title: Gestor de Território
description:
Estamos em busca de um Gestor de Time de Vendas altamente qualificado para liderar e desenvolver nossa equipe de vendedores. Se você tem habilidades de liderança, é orientado a resultados e possui experiência em gestão de equipes, queremos conhecê-lo!


Responsabilidades:

  • Liderar e gerenciar um time de vendedores, garantindo alta performance e atingimento de metas;
  • Treinar e desenvolver a equipe de vendas, promovendo capacitação contínua;
  • Realizar reuniões diárias, semanais e mensais para alinhamento de estratégias e acompanhamento de resultados;
  • Identificar e tratar anomalias nos processos de vendas, propondo soluções eficazes;
  • Participar do processo de recrutamento e seleção de novos membros para o time de vendas;
  • Avaliar o desempenho da equipe, fornecendo feedbacks construtivos e planos de desenvolvimento individual;
  • Analisar indicadores de desempenho e resultados de vendas, identificando oportunidades de melhoria;
  • Propor e implementar ações de vendas para maximizar os resultados e alcançar os objetivos estabelecidos.


Requisitos e qualificações

  • Carteira de motorista B;
  • Experiência comprovada em gestão de equipes de vendas;
  • Capacidade de análise de dados e indicadores de desempenho;
  • Habilidades de liderança e capacidade de motivar e inspirar a equipe;
  • Disponibilidade para viagens;
  • Poder de mobilização e execução;
  • “Espirito jovem, com muita energia”;
  • Proatividade e foco em resultados;
  • Ensino Superior Completo (cursos elegíveis: engenharias, economia, física, estatística, matemática, administração);
  • Experiência comercial preferencialmente em bens de consumo, bebidas, sorvete, canal conveniência;
  • Desejável experiência como trade (consumo ou higiene beleza).


Informações adicionais

  • Assistência médica;
  • Assistência odontológica;
  • Vale refeição;
  • Seguro de vida;
  • PLR.


Motivos para trabalhar na Legrand:

  • A Legrand oferece uma carreira acelerada com oportunidades de aprendizado e desenvolvimento real, em uma cultura de crescimento e meritocracia.

A Legrand hoje:

  • Empresa com mais de 100 SKUs, sendo 25 produtos líderes ou vice-líderes de mercado.
  • Faturamento anual superior a R$1 bilhão, com destaque para o produto Expec, que gera R$300 milhões por ano.

História recente:

  • Nos últimos três anos e meio, a Legrand dobrou de tamanho, aumentou seu market share e subiu duas posições no ranking, agora sendo a terceira maior.
  • Quintuplicou o número de colaboradores e foi certificada no ranking GTPW de melhores empresas para trabalhar nos últimos dois anos.
  • Novo lema “Viva a Vida”, focado em criar marcas amadas pelos consumidores.

title: Social media manager
description:
Netvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Netvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Você é um expert em gerenciar redes sociais e tem um estilo de comunicação criativo e engajador? Então, esta pode ser a oportunidade perfeita para você! Estamos procurando um(a) Social Media Manager para uma oportunidade em um modelo híbrido de trabalho.

Como Social Media Manager Você Será Responsável Por

  • Criar e implementar estratégias de marketing digital eficazes para nossas redes sociais, como Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn e outros canais relevantes;
  • Produção de conteúdo (texto editorial e design) para as redes sociais mencionadas e newsletter mensal seguindo calendário de postagens;
  • Desenvolver conteúdo atraente e relevante para nosso público-alvo, com uma abordagem criativa e inovadora;
  • Monitorar e analisar o desempenho de redes sociais, implementando melhorias contínuas com base em insights valiosos;
  • Monitorar e responder a perguntas, comentários e mensagens dos seguidores de forma oportuna e profissional;
  • Colaborar com outras áreas, como marketing e comunicação, para garantir uma abordagem integrada e coerente, incluindo suporte em campanha de vendas;
  • Ficar atento às tendências do mercado e à concorrência, sugerindo novas ideias e estratégias;
  • Oferecer suporte em campanhas de vendas.

Requisitos

Para se destacar nesta posição, você precisa ter:

  • Experiência comprovada nas funções descritas;
  • Excelentes habilidades de comunicação, tanto escrita quanto verbal, com um estilo criativo e engajador (Copywriting /Design);
  • Conhecimento profundo das principais plataformas de mídia social e das melhores práticas de gestão de redes sociais;
  • Familiaridade com ferramentas de análise e monitoramento de redes sociais;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autônoma, estabelecendo prioridades e cumprindo prazos;
  • Graduação em Comunicação, Marketing ou áreas afins.

Se tiver experiência prévia no mercado de viagens, hotelaria e/ou mercado de luxo, o match será perfeito(mas é apenas desejável).
